p: Consequently, a typical pharmacy in Greece has a lower turnover than in Poland, where the number of pharmacies is very high and in Latvia (a value similar to that in Poland). In other European countries, pharmacies have higher potential. Pharmacy turnover is at least twice as high in eleven countries. Among countries with a GDP per capita similar to that of Poland, pharmacy turnover is higherâ€”twice as high in the Czech Republic and three times as high in Hungary. Considering the purchasing power of Polish residents, the average turnover of a Polish pharmacy is 926,000 USD a year. Meanwhile, a pharmacy in the Czech Republic reported 1.68 million USD a year and in France 1.99 million USD. Pharmacies generate the highest average turnover in Austria, Denmark, and the Netherlands, respectively, 3.88 million, 3.52 million, and 3.47 million USD due to the low density of pharmacies [ 13].
